summary: The HIV Prevention Now Act (H.R. 5126) introduced in the House of Representatives on September 4, 2025, appropriates $2,165,000,000 for programs and activities of the National Center for HIV, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and Tuberculosis Prevention within the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for fiscal year 2026. The funds are earmarked specifically for the National Center and are in addition to existing appropriations for the Department of Health and Human Services.
